title: Keeps logging me out
text: App worked good for a while and we were happy with our purchase but now I keep getting logged out and have to log back in. I would hold off on buying this product until after they are able to roll out a fix.

title: Smart location still broken plus privacy issue
text:
UPDATE - I’ve also just discovered that in addition to smart location still turning itself off, it also keeps automatically turning on the App Analytics option. So make sure you keep unchecking that option multiple times a day if you don’t want your personal analytics data sent to Logitech.
Their change log is right in that this update seemingly fixes the login issues. But smart location is still turning itself off just as frequently as when this whole thing broke back in the June update. Makes smart location still mostly useless. Have tried logging out of all devices and the web, deleting the app, reinstalling. Also has an annoying feature where the list of devices for smart location keeps growing with multiple copies of the same devices. How much longer is this app going to stay broken? It used to be really good prior to June.

title: New upgrade is horrible
text:
Update: these problems were fixed in the last app update. Thanks for responding!

You have to sign in on their website to use this app now. HORRIBLE and now I’m stuck with 3 cameras where the whole point was the ease of the app. You can get a camera from anyone, the app is the difference maker.

title: 12/04.   Smart location still not working.
text: It seems to be pretty consistent not working. Just have to be correcting all the time. The latest update has corrected everything. Have two - one inside and one outside - great cameras. Use them with HomeKit.

title: Not great
text: This has great potential, but it is currently far from where it should be. There is no Apple TV support. There is no iPad multitasking support. We use the camera as a baby monitor, so multitasking and picture in picture would be really nice to have. It also has no way to change the WiFi network in the app - you have to do a factory reset on the camera just to change what WiFi you want to use. That is a horrendous pain to deal with when you are traveling and staying at a new place every night. It does not support background audio. It is completely dependent on “cloud” servers to function at all, even if you have the remote recording feature turned off. You can have a perfectly functioning LAN, but the whole thing will stop working if it can’t talk to Logitech. It desperately needs the ability to function locally in at least a basic mode. Ideally it could function in full mode too and be able to utilize NAS instead of cloud storage. Logitech used to be a great hardware company. Now they seem to be crippling their hardware to try and sell software service subscriptions. That is not what I or I imagine most people want. Focus on giving customers what they want and you’ll make lots of money. Focus on making lots of money and you’ll go the way of all the other has-been companies.

title: Worked until it didn’t.
text: Worked great on my old iPhone. Spent an hour and a half on the phone with customer support, and it absolutely will not work on my new iPhone. As I don’t have another phone or an iPad, I’m out of luck. My $200 Logitech camera is now a useless piece of junk.

title: Terrible ap
text: I have to log in every time I open the ap and is incredibly slow to play back videos. Very frustrating and disappointing to say the least.

title: Good start but needs some work
text: A must have app if you’re using a Logi Circle camera.  I have the Logi Circle2 and love the camera.  I also like it does’t broadcast 24/7 and only records when there is movement.  That saves on internet usage.  The app needs some work though. The live feed gets frozen if you are running the app in the background and then open it again.  You have to force close the app and then reopen EVERYTIME you open the app.  The other issue is with the Smart Notifications.  You are only able to geofence your phone and not multiple phones using the same account.  If I’m home I won’t get notifications of movement which is nice and expected of any camera being used in 2018.  But if I’m gone and my wife is home with her phone connected to the camera I will get notifications of movement.  The Nest camera and app allows multiple phones to be synced.  That way everyone only gets notifications if ALL phones are not within the geofence area.  If they add this functionality and improve the app stabilization I would give this 5 stars and tell everyone I know to buy one of these.

title: Switched to a better camera
text:
Update 23 may 2017: camera has turned into utter garbage. Went down a week ago and has not worked since. Tried resetting it back to factory default & setting up again but nothing works. First it says the cloud servers were down. Then it's trying to tell me I don't have an internet connection when I clearly do. Lowering my rating to 1 star. Do yourself a favor and get a different camera. This is not built to last. 

Update 22 December: With every update the app seems to get worse and worse. My camera now goes offline for no reason at least 5 times a day. Downloading of clips is still broken. If you are contemplating buying this camera don't do it. I only still use it because I doubt I'd be able to resell it for any money. 

Been a logi circle owner for about a year. I just recently bought an arlo q camera to replace it and I gotta say I couldn't be happier. Wish I just would've got it from the get-go. 7 days of free recording vs the logi circles 24 hours. It's a no brainer. Plus it's much more customizable and supports IFTTT. Logi circle works well but there's just better options out there with more features. The logi circle is definitely not worth the $200 I spent on it.

title: FRAGILE! (Previously great app rendered far worse by update)
text:
Echoing what user bellyhanglow said, the so-called security improvement shipped by a recent update has made the usage MUCH worse. Unlike that user I have been able to login and view my subscription videos on my multiple cameras BUT I find I am often astonished by a “requirement” to login AGAIN and sometimes that happens shortly after having viewed the cameras without any device pauses or downtime’s. I also occasionally get bounced back & forth between browser and app with login failures but I have found a method of short-circuiting it after it begins. Users should NEVER need to debug apps! 
If indeed there is actually any improved security it has come at the price of stupendously fragile connection now. 
If the connections don’t become stable I cannot imagine that I will renew my logi circle subscriptions when they come up for renewal in a few months.

title: Works Great! Perfect Video Monitor
text:
Continuous live feed makes this camera awesome! It now works really well as a baby monitor. When reviewing monitors these days, a lot of the reviews care little about a battery, but you need to be able to move the camera around the house without a cord if your gonna use this as a baby monitor. The battery does well enough for me. 4-6 hours depending on use. It has a save battery option but no telling how helpful it is to use. Video quality is definitely good enough and the night vision works great. The app is pretty simple and easy to use.  Options like being able to take a photo while watching a live feed is cool. Love the FREE 24 cloud storage. PLEASE don't change that feature. Huge selling point for me! If after 24 hours I haven't downloaded it, I probably don't want it anyways.
This is a 5 star app and video monitor in my book!

title: Why am I getting 50 notifications a minute?
text: We use this as a dog camera, and it's great. Yesterday, I left work in the middle of the day to go untangle my puppy, who had chewed up her towel and gotten the strings wrapped around her neck. So it's a handy little device. But this new app update is complete garbage. The constant notifications are driving me insane. It's literally sending me notifications at least once a minute, but they've been totally still and napping for hours. Alert me when there's significant activity; not when the dogs are simply breathing. I don't want to change the settings; because if they're actually doing something (like chewing), I want to be alerted that moment, so I can tell them to stop. And the "person detected" feature is both creepy and inaccurate. Not a happy camper.

title: Needs Improvements
text:
PROS: with the subscription, you can create up to five zones, via completely customizable shapes. This was perfect for me, as I live on a very busy street and need to focus on areas on our property, vs the usual busy traffic and pedestrians. 

CONS: although the zones have helped reduce the noise and bombarding of notifications, I’m still getting “likely detected” notifications for zones (even though I specifically only selected the zones for notifications, not outside zone activity). This means that motion is detected near, but NOT INSIDE the zones and is notified still. What is the point of the zone feature I am paying for then??? I have a bus stop and busy side walk in front of my home so there will always be “person/motion likely detected” notifications clogging my phone. It’s very difficult to discern if it is a true threat or not. 

^ Please fix or provide a toggle option for this!

title: Last update broke the night vision!
text:
I'm glad to see that Logitech is continually making updates and adding features. However the last firmware update has cause the cameras night vision to turn on and off repeatedly in a completely dark room. We use the cam as a baby monitor, but currently we had to shut off the night vision because it would turn off about 5-10 secs after it would turn on; and repeat. Each time making a clicking noise in the room. The camera hangs from the wall above the crib, just as it did before the update.  I've tried rebooting and even a full reset with re-adding it to the account. Nothing changed. So it must be your update and it's probably server side as I believe that's how you control turning on the cameras night vision. It's not a decision the camera itself makes. 
Please fix it, we want to like the camera again. 
Lastly, I want to say thank you for removing the 3 min timeout that rendered the cam useless as a baby monitor.

title: Partially fixed
text:
The login issue doesn’t occur as often (for now), but the big issue I’ve noticed over weeks is that the videos don’t appear to always get deleted. Not sure why this happens. There needs to be a much better way to ensure that videos are deleted. The current method is cumbersome and I don’t believe the videos are always getting deleted. I’ve been checking 2x with the app. Sometimes 24 hours later a video reappears and it’s unsettling.

I haven’t bothered using the app with the Home app or smart location for awhile because I have another type of camera that does it and it’s a backup in the event the Logi has an outage. I had a Logi cam that was broken by a bad firmware update. When not in use I unplug cameras due to privacy concerns. This app doesn’t integrate enough with iOS.

title: Using App Breaks HomeKit Functionality
text: I purchased this camera because of its compatibility with HomeKit. After using the camera for a day with HomeKit only (and no issues) I downloaded the App to tweak some settings. Hours later I opened the Home App and noticed that the feed would not load, opened the Logi Circle App and the feed was working in App. I changed the settings back to default in the Logi Circle App to see if one of my changes had caused the issue but that didn’t fix it. I unpaired the camera from the Logi Circle App and HomeKit then paired it back for a week and it worked all week. I then paired the camera back to the Logi Circle App and within hours the feed in the Home App was no longer working. This App breaks the camera’s HomeKit compatibility. I would not recommend this camera if you want to use it with HomeKit and the Logi Circle App, it only works with one or the other. Hopefully Logitech will fix this, if not I will be returning the camera and deleting the App.

title: What is going on?!
text:
Following the latest update to the app, it continually logs me out. There is no monitoring at this point. If the cameras trigger an event, you constantly first have go through the entire log in and validation process before you can view the cameras! I’m assuming this is a new method of forcing users to pay for the monitoring service instead of the standalone user camera monitoring.   After purchasing several cameras I now have to start over and will be tearing them out and replacing. Complete waste of money and time.

This just repeats and does not allow actual log in. I cannot describe the disappointment and total anger that I spent so much money and time on these cameras. Avoid and try anything but these!

title: Great Performance
text:
This is a very good product. I have it running 24/7. Notifications issue need to be fixed, why! If you use the app on two different mobiles, the mobile notifications won't work on both mobiles 📱 but it will send notifications to one of these connected mobiles, but still you can enjoy the HD resolution. Make sure you have a steady internet connection for a faster recording loading as the camera with slow connection might take longer to load. 
Tip: for dark night recording, please install strong light sensors outside this will extremely help your logi security camera to record a better and higher resolution at night. 

All my respect to Logitech Products 👍

title: Kudos for enable HomeKit secure
text: The camera has been working very reliably for 1.5 years, running 24/7. I have had no issue using either the Logi app or HomeKit. Now, Logitech just enabled HomeKit Secure via firmware upgrade (note: it renders the Logi app obsolete and they warn you clearly to that regard). Big thank you to Logitech for enabling a new HomeKit feature on a 1.5 year old camera. I was waiting to see who was moving on HomeKit Secure to make my purchase decision, and now will very well add another Circle to my collection because they chose not to penalize existing customers. Maybe Logitech learned something after years of dismal customer support. That’s called customer retention. A rare feat in the tech world today.

title: New purchase, works well
text:
Got two camera for Christmas. They’re easy to set up and have a good selection of options. I look forward to see what options will be added. 

I have both cameras on 5G at home and they work great. Notifications come about 30 seconds after an event. The person identification works great. My main use case is to watch my home’s windows and entrances. The IR settings are great too, but only seem to come on when the camera needs it. 

As far as landscape view only, as others have commented, it would be nice if the controls of the camera turned to portrait while keeping the camera full screen. In my case, one window is watching a vertical range and another is horizontal. It has been fine working with the sideways view for now but it would be nice to have the option to set the camera as portrait-view in my settings. 

Does not work with home kit for me, but this app works well enough that it is not an issue. It initially connects to the camera and gets the feed, then says camera not responding.

title: AWFUL
text:
I’ve tried logging in 35 times without success. With a rash of recent car thefts and break-ins in my neighborhood I’d like to be able to see what set the alert off and not spend 10 minutes attempting to log in. This used to be a good set up but since the new update it’s absolutely awful and there’s no point in having it if I can’t actually see what is setting the alert off.

Following up after several “remove the app and reinstall” chats with support. It’s still AWFUL. Nothing has changed, I still have to log in and that takes me to another page which doesn’t log me in, and I do this 15-20 times before I give up. Latest request from support was to go to settings in the Logi circle app, go to help and submit a diagnostics report. If I can’t log into the app I can’t submit a report, thanks for the help.

title: Inadequate App design
text: Just bought 4 of the these cameras because of their design and they fit most of needs. App however is very in thoughtfully created. It's does not have neat features that Nest or Arlo provides. To begin with it does not allow you to turn it on or off by certain schedule. I have to turn it on and off if I don't want to use it when I am home. A simply idea that circle tech team just missed. For all four cameras I have to apply the same settings individually. It would be nice to be able to control all cameras in the system through one interface. Multi camera pan randomly picks a camera that will have largest view. I should be able to select what camera gets the largest view. More over the viewing pan is very poorly designed. Overall, I am giving it one star because the app lacks basic functions. Camera itself is good except the speaker crackles very bad.

title: Suggestions
text:
Why not find bugs before deployment? Had to uninstall and re-install to get app to work again after last update. C-mon guys your supposed to be the legendary web cam developers. Everything should be seamless and polished. Why can you not seek forward while zoomed...nobody thought of that? The one thing that drew me into buying the camera was seeking quickly through the each motion detected event quickly. Why not seek fast option for each activated sequence? You guys are developing apps like amateurs. I have faith that you will surpass my expectations in future versions. Right now I will settle

1. Adjust playback speed, skip ahead 10 sec or scroll function. I spend too much time moving the slider over an inch waiting it to load sliding another inch waiting to load over and over until the whole footage has been reviewed. 

2. Times to be alerted. I don't need to be alerted when I am home. Could it be scheduled. 

3. The daily brief is nice but misses many things. What's wrong with including all scenes 

I will write another review as this cool little cam evolves.

title: Camera’s nice but the app needs a lot of work.
text:
First off, which is obvious from the moment you open it…it only works in landscape. I get that the video is 16:9, that doesn’t mean I want to turn my phone sideways automatically. A more elegant solution would be to move the UI below the video playback area when holding in portrait. I don’t need detail, I need to see a preview to determine whether or not the notification I’ve received is important.

Speaking of notifications. Smart locations work intermittently, and often deliver false positives such as when you are home, or when light changes drastically. Sometimes, you get nothing. Meh.

The app will often hang and refuse to update, forcing you to quit. The camera will still be viewable via HomeKit, etc.

title: Camera Feed Loading Takes Too Long
text:
The features of the camera and app are great but the camera feeds takes forever to load. If you have someone knocking on the door you can’t immediately view the feed as it takes time to load. I have to log in on a computer to the Logi Circle site and get better response and load times there than through the application.

It seems that when you view the live feed, you are not streaming the feed directly from the camera, instead you viewing the feed that is being streamed to a Logi Circle server. It would be better off updating the application so that when you view the live feed you are pulling the stream straight from the camera and not from a Logi Circle server.

Reviewing past recordings is the same result; loading times take forever.

title: Used to be good, now unusable
text:
Logitech recently changed their security authentication process and it has made the app nearly unusable. Sometimes you can log in right away, sometimes you are forced to try logging in 10+ times until you give up. What is the point of a security system that you can’t check when you need to?

UPDATE: The developer contacted me in response to this review and asked me to try the beta of the next version of the app. It seems to have fixed the problem. Hopefully they roll it out widely soon! Star rating conditionally upgraded anticipating the fix.

title: So so as a baby monitor
text:
The quality of the video is much better than our previous withings baby monitor.  And we like the way this app presents various movement throughout the day in case we have a need to peek back.

The camera seems to need updates all the time, and every time it does, the app gets confused about the state of settings on the camera. I have to plan on 10 or 15 minutes to fiddle with it to get the LED setting to go off again after firmware updates because the app seems to get confused about the camera’s view of the setting every time.  If it happen d rarely I could live with it, but I’ve only had the camera for a month and a half and I’m sure I’ve had to do it 4 times...

title: Nice update, great potential
text:
This app update to iPhone X was a welcomed upgrade, however, the app has great potential in its current state. It works, but just it starting to feel dated and a bit clunky. Listing of enhancements follows:

-Better geofenced smart alerts when signed in on 2 devices. Currently, if one device is home and another is away, the other device gets all the alerts. There should be an option to have alerts pushed ONLY when all signed in devices are away from home.
-app icons on left side can be pushed further left into the “notch” on iPhone X to improve cleanliness of video playback window. 
-Wi-Fi & battery status icons found on the camera settings page can be moved to the video playback window on the left side in the notch as well. 
-live video playback for all cameras simultaneously in the split screen view would be a welcomed upgrade. 
-turn off camera/privacy mode when home would be great 

Finally, other camera manufacturers have more robust feature sets. Logi needs to keep pushing forward to stay competitive. Keep at it!

title: Lots of potential, but Software needs work
text: The camera hardware is really nice and the quality is good as long as you don’t want to use 1080p in the Home app. The iPhone and iPad app are much more capable, but I really wish I could turn the camera into privacy mode based off my location or HomeKit scene. This would be particularly useful for guests who may not be 100% comfortable with a home security camera. I also wish the AI features were a little cheaper if you just have 1x camera like I do. $9.99 to have the facial recognition is a little steep. I love checking in on my cat when I’m on the go from my Apple Watch. That is a very nice feature.

title: HomeKit integration still needs work
text:
Updated to newest firmware.  Everything seems to work well within the logi standalone app, but Home App needs a lot more work.  

I'm comparing HK capability to the Omna 180 and the omna loads live streaming within a few seconds while the logi takes much longer.  The Omna 180 also refreshes the live feed every time you open it in the Home app.  Not the case at all with the Circle 2.  I have to open the Omna camera and then the circle 2 before it refreshes a new live feed.  I believe this to be a simple software fix but until then the Omna cam is still superior in every way except for outdoor functionality.  

***sad that you can only live stream in home app in 720p.  Such a shame!

title: App is horrible!
text: I keep rewriting reviews since they keep getting ‘reset’, but the funny thing is, Logitech just can’t escape a bad rating no matter how many times they delete the reviews and have people start over. The log in process is a total joke. I have to repeatedly ‘log in’ which takes me to Safari, which then takes me back to the Circle app and has me repeat until it decides to finally work. It’s clear Logitech wants to abandon this app and the Circle hardware for their new stuff because they refuse to fix this even though it’s been broken for about three months. Do your developers use Git? Maybe you can just redeploy the previous version until you can get some developers who understand how SSO and security work.

title: Version 3.5 is awful.
text: The new “security” has the app open a browser to login and launch the app.  This is the worst design EVER!  The moron that created it should be fired and the app needs to go back to all apple security using a thumbprint or face-login.  The web app isn’t much better timing out every hour forcing a re-login.  Why do I want to relogin to my security system every hour when I’m using it to watch my outdoor security cameras???  The app should also permit streaming from multiple cameras at once instead of a snapshot when refreshed, or every so often….  If you are looking at these cameras, don’t spend the money.  They aren’t worth the irritation.  Logitech, fix the system, or provide an API to the camera feeds to let us bypass your incapable apps.

title: 4 cameras sending alerts but no way to see recording!
text:
C’mon - just to get our ID for marketing monetization, you blow up something that’s been working well? Please fix this or these cameras have to be junked - totally fail on home security, which is why most people buy these devices - NOT for fancy SSO - and then if you pick facial recognition and that fails (as it did) one cannot log into with email - who thought of that user experience?

title: Extremely frustrating to log in

Most of time can’t log in with out repeatedly pressing then log in app which takes me to something called “secure log in” which takes me back to the app where the process started all over again. This can go on a dozen or more times. Nothing I try seems to work consistently even closing out the app. When you finally get to log in decent quality but tonight I have been trying for over a couple hours. Turing off and on my phone doesn’t work either. No luck tonight. Tomorrow I get a reliable security system to protect my business. This is a violation of warranty of fitness and the company should be sued!

title: Latest Update Broke Functionality
text:
Since this last update, the app is constantly forcing me to re-log in. And there is no real warning. Notifications with previews work, then it changes to no preview. Then no notifications at all. I’ll launch the app to see what the issue is and I’m forced, several times, to launch the website then relaunch the app to log back in. But why am I logged out so much?

If that wasn’t enough, once the app has finally let me back in. It shows all of the cameras are now offline. Funny because they still show up in HomeKit. 

Could we fix this please? Single sign on is supposed to make the experience better. Not keep kicking us out of the app every few hours.

title: Constantly goes offline
text:
Despite having strong internet throughout our small apartment, the camera is always going offline. This has been happening for a while and I finally got so fed up this morning after waking up to 18(!) “camera is offline” notifications that I decided to post my review.

I can be streaming 4K content on my Apple TV and I’ll simultaneously get alerts that the camera is offline. How can that be? Especially when I’m getting pinged every 20 mins by the app when I’m at work. Unfortunately, I can’t recommend this to anyone until it’s fixed.

UPDATE: Has been offline for 3 straight days. Absolute garbage product and wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.

title: After update delete and reinstall
text: After the latest update in June every time I try to open the app it would take me to the website to re-login. After a few frustrating weeks I decided to delete the app and reinstall it and since then I’ve had no issues. Overall great camera and app with ability to talk through the camera. One app with cameras in multiple locations. Quick setup and easy to use cameras and app.

title: Really nice camera but needs a couple things
text: I really like these cameras I have 2 of them. I got them for the Apple HomeKit ability. They work pretty good for the most part and I like the new update with the smart location stuff but is there some way you can update that so I can add other family members devices to the list. That would be nice to have so when my son is home and I’m not home I don’t get alerts ever 5 minutes that he walks by the camera. That is the only thing I don’t like about these cameras but other than that they would pretty well.

title: Ok cameras; terrible app
text:
To anyone who just bought this camera....return it immediately and get your money back while you still can.

The cameras are pretty worthless when the app is as terrible as this. Previously terrible response time for pulling up videos. I was hoping the latest app update.....which has been a loooong while since the last one...I was hoping the “bug fixes” would actually fix it. But things are only worse. Now I can’t even get recorded videos to play. For the annual fee I pay I expect things to work as a basic standard. These cameras are now a piece of junk because I am going to have to switch to another camera with a reliable app.

title: Slightly buggy
text:
The 3.1 and 3.1.1 versions have this annoying bug that sometimes doesn’t open up my live view when I start the app. I have to click away from the live view (e.g., to the day brief) and then click back to the live view. 

This issue mostly comes up if I click the home button with the live view on. The camera LED goes when and then back to green for a few minutes before switching to white. When I open the app again, it gets stuck trying to load the live view. 

I thought it might go away in iOS 11, but it didn’t. Hopefully the next update fixes this. Otherwise, it’s a good app.

title: App constantly logging out by it self with latest update
text:
With latest update app ver. 3.5.58; it keeps on logging out it self and forces user to re-login constantly which agitates user to the max degree. The activity notifications also has a major flaw; it pushes out three of the same activity notifications for every single push alerts which are also extremely cumbersome and frustrating to endure.
No matter how great the device is, it’s only as good as application driven by thoughtful minds. It is abundantly evident that this app is driven by absent minded developers or perhaps this company may have an owner risk all together. 
Please fix the issue before we decide to never to invest in your company’s stock.

title: Constant logouts, flaky web sso auth
text: This app went from “not great” to “infuriating” in the recent update. It’s constantly logging me out, and then it bounces you out to Safari to login as if we haven’t solved the problem of logging in inside of an app years ago. Sometimes it just doesn’t work, sometimes it’s slow, but every time it takes long enough that I end up missing whatever was happening on the camera that I was trying to check on. How absurd is it that it’s faster for me to go downstairs, walk across the house, and look out the front window to see who is at the door than to try open the notification from my camera and look at the video?

title: Horrible
text: I first purchased the wireless circle 2 for outdoor I was very happy with the performance of the camera and the alerts that I purchased 2 more wired for outdoor but recently like everyone else is having issues with the app will not let you view the camera unless you sign in every time this could be one of the worst experiences I have had so far if nothing changes in the next few months I will switch to ring or nest witch I would recommend everyone else do the same ,,reason I purchased this in the first place was because of a full wireless camera I should’ve went with my instinct and just went with the ring from the beginning

title: Very slow
text: Thought I could use it similarly to the Ring Doorbell but it takes way too long for the live view to come up. The voice delay is also delayed by about 3 seconds so you really can’t communicate with someone at your door with it. The daily recap works some of the time but not always. If you want any more than a day’s recap you need to buy a subscription to store videos longer which I would do if the app worked faster. As a baby monitor it is acceptable but as a security camera it is worthless. I have two cameras which I will probably send to electronic recycling. I thought this would be a good wireless solution but I was wrong. If you are reading this and can still return the camera I would.

title: Does what it’s supposed to
text:
I think this app does what it’s supposed to. Unfortunately I find it lacks soul and isn’t engaging me as a consumer. It isn’t an app that I feel that I enjoy interacting with. What I feel is lacking the most is a portrait mode. I don’t want to have to turn my phone sideways just to use the app. It’s great to be able to do it and get a better view, but I don’t think it should be forced. 

But it does what it’s designed to do. View my camera, change settings. If you make it work in portrait, that would instantly bring my rating up to ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. For that last star it would have to gain some soul and engage me.

title: Ditching Logitech for Ring
text:
I’ve given Logitech a month to fix their terrible update, and the newest update is still no good.
I don’t understand how you can read these reviews and not jump at the loss of customers from a destructive update. I work in software, I understand the development cycle. This should have been fixed by now (or at least reverted SSO functionality. I’ve been paying for monthly services and will be canceling and moving onto Ring. 
I love the camera, and everything was good for the last year, but I’ve given up.
Please, if you’re reading this, return the camera if you can, or don’t bother relying on it for security.

title: Smart location no longer functions
text:
We’ve had Logitech circle 2 cameras for several years to keep an eye on the house and they’ve been great overall. However, the latest iOS app update broke the smart location function; every time I leave the house a pop up notification states “location failed to update from this device” and our ‘doggy cam’ remains off. 

Tried logging out of all devices, deleting and reinstalling the apps, resetting the cameras, nothing works. We could just leave it on but I like the illusion of privacy. Hope Logitech fixes this in an update soon or I’ll have to look for other options.

title: Worst app on my entire phone!
text: When I first got this camera I was very happy but somewhere along the way things hit a sharp decline. The first problem was when they stopped in-app purchases and I could no longer manage my subscription or payment through the app. In the past few months the app has essentially stopped working because all it does now is link me to the web site and I have to log in every time I need to check my camera. In this day and age the app makes the camera and the app right now is complete trash, therefore making this camera complete trash. I will be switching very soon .

title: Broken Preview Notification
text: This latest update broke a very useful feature.  When I receive activity alert notifications the image preview is missing.  I’ve tried uninstalling/reinstalling, power cycling, checked every app and phone setting for notifications always on or while unlocked.  Nothing has been able to resolve the issue.  Everything was working perfectly fine before the latest updated.  I’ve also had the app log me out and I was unable to verify my login because I was stuck in a login loop with this new authentication system that came with the new Logi app update.

title: Just ok - notifications are useless
text: I wanted to receive notifications when there is high movement outside (not necessarily people) but there needs to be better options for choosing the motion sensitivity. The only options for sensitivity for alerts are “all” and “high activity”. I have it set on high activity but i receive 30+ notifications a day due to the wind moving the trees (shadows). Even free solutions such as the manything app has a 10 point motion sensitivity setting. Notifications are useless. Should have gotten an arlo. You also have to pay for motion zones (another free feature on manything). They also need an apple tv app.

title: Day brief shortened, poor airplay mirroring from iPad Pro
text:
The last update has shortened the Day Brief video to only include from 1 minute after midnight to the current time of day rather than a full 24 hour day brief.  For instance if you run a day brief at 9 am Monday it only shows you the highlights from midnight Sunday until 9 am Monday morning.  You still have the ability to go back and search manually through each individual video clip from last 24 hours individually but it is very time consuming to do so.
I believe most want the full 24 hour day brief or give people an option to choose.

The play slider does not function the way you would expect.  No easy ability to drag the slider to quickly skip areas of the video.

Airplay mirroring to Apple TV does not fill screen from iPad Pro (3rd generation) - actually works better and fills screen when mirroring from an iPhone 6.

title: Almost Perfect
text: Here's what I use mine for, I have it in my kids room. I love that it records in the cloud for free the moments that matter. So I like having it on all the time so I can later download special or funny moments that happen. But I really want a quick way to engage (turn on) the previously used smart alert settings. So that way when my youngest takes a nap, I can be alerted when she moves and is waking up. A 3D press on the icon is the quickest way I can think to do this. Please set up that feature?! Thanks

title: Paid a lot and am left out to dry!
text: Been happy with the product for a couple years, but was suddenly logged out and it will not let me back in the app. This isn’t a password issue, the account logs in fine, but the app just gets kicked back to the login screen with no explanation as to why. Can’t even log on to use the camera anymore. After reading all the reviews of people having the same problems and getting no support, I’ll be moving on from Logitech and likely never to return. If a company can’t back their products, I can’t be bothered to remain a customer. Shame.

title: Was a great app, now useless due to the SSO login change
text:
I have 9 cameras, 4 Logi Circles and 5 from other brands. The Logi Circles were my favourite cameras, partly due to how great this app was to view videos from them vs the other cameras.

Now with the latest changes to the login process, using SSO with Logitech’s Logi ID, the app is useless. It never stays logged in, and it’s a long process to log in, jumping through the browser etc (presumably using OAuth). Half the time the login process doesn’t even work and you have to repeat it over and over until you’ve done the right rain dance.

If you hear a noise outside and want to quickly check what it was via the cameras, you just can’t anymore. By the time you’ve done the login dance, the cause of the noise is already gone, or has already gotten in the house and is ready to murder you. Yes, this update may actually cost lives.

Please fix this Logitech. Or refund our money for the cameras. They weren’t cheap.

title: Avoid this app at all costs!!
text:
The Logitech Circle camera itself is decent, at best. I got it to monitor my car in my condo complex parking lot, though beyond about 10-15 feet, reading license plate numbers or seeing identifiable faces is all but impossible. But it’s unique window mount allows the camera to be placed where other cams wouldn’t work for me. There’s also an incessant rapid clicking noise in the audio, like a playing card being ran over bicycle spokes. Very weird, and just really annoying in general. 

The Logi Circle app itself, though, is really where things go downhill fast. First, the odds of its auto-record feature successfully recording an important event, like, say your car getting broken into, are pretty low. You might get the very beginning or the very end, before it cuts in/out, or a random segment in between. And if you happen to see something occurring in real-time that you’d like to record, then good luck with that same sketchy auto-record, as there’s no option for you to manually start/stop recording something. 

The other issue is trying to scroll back in time to view events from earlier in the day. I have 100/10Mbps internet over WiFi, and it regularly test at or above those speeds. The cam is in the same room as the WiFi router, and all other devices in the House work just fine from it, including an Arlo Q cam, which works much better than the Circle cam. In my somewhat busy parking lot, there might have a dozen to a few dozen events (people/cars going by, etc) auto-recorded per hour, but if you want to scroll much more than 2 hours into the past, then be prepared to wait. You’ll simply see a spinning wheel for every couple hours you want to go back, which won’t stop for about 1-3 mins, and when it does, you may or may not have a play button available to view an actual clip. Count on it taking about 10-15 mins to actually get to the beginning of a 24hr day. By that point you’ve likely given up, reminding yourself to never by another Logitech security camera again. 

You’ve been warned. Unless you must have a camera that mounts to a window, there is absolutely zero reason to ever consider a Circle cam, and it’s embarrassingly bad app, over just about anything else that’s out there.

title: Needs a lot of work!
text:
The physical product (Logitech Circle 2) is fantastic, however this app lets it down severely.
If it wasn’t for Apple HomeKit support and being able to view the cameras in the home app I would have already returned the cameras, here’s why:

The app only talks to the cameras through the Logitech servers over the internet, even if you are in the same network as the camera it won’t talk directly to the camera. You guys need to allow for a LAN connection, if HomeKit can do it so easily then it can’t that be hard to add a simple little toggle for this feature in your app. I’m still waiting for them to connect my fiber, which means I have pretty slow internet and it makes viewing the cameras at home in my own network in this app an extremely slow and a very delayed experience, to the point where it’s unusable!!! If it wasn’t for HomeKit’s ability to view the camera over the LAN network I would have returned the cameras. IT’S A MASSIVE OVERSIGHT!
The app is stuck in landscape mode, I don’t like the fact that I’m forced into landscape mode.
The UI feels generally awkward and unintuitive, the timeline bubble thing on the side is pretty good but the rest of the app just feels a bit clunky and hard to navigate, it’s mostly to do with being stuck in landscape.
There’s no picture-in-picture mode for the iPad, again, Apple HomeKit can do it but your app can’t.
There’s no Apple TV app, I hardly use other apps on my Apple TV but being able to view my security cameras on my TV (WITH A LAN CONNECTION) would be brilliant, please fix this app with LAN support and bring it to the Apple TV.

Additionally the ability to have the cameras record to a local NAS device would be fantastic and make these cameras worth twice the price in my opinion, I know you guys want to sell subscriptions but I guarantee that if you add that functionality you’d sell twice as many cameras as it would appeal to many many more people especially those with with slower internet speeds or capped data plans, not everyone likes the cloud or wants their cameras constantly uploading and using bandwidth, local network recording would take these cameras to a whole new level.

Apple’s HomeKit integration is a must, if you’re using these cameras and not using HomeKit you need to try it out, for me it’s the only reason I haven’t returned the cameras, it allows for LAN connections and iPad picture-in-picture support as well as fantastic notifications that allow you to view the camera from within a notification on your lock screen with a 3D Touch hard press, and if like me you have Philips Hue lights you can link the camera to the lights for automation for movement or my favourite little feature is the “light” button under the camera feed when viewed from a notification that will turn on all the lights in the same room as the camera. 

I’ve said it multiple times in this review and I’ll say it again. 
HOMEKIT MAKES THESE CAMERAS

These cameras are nothing without HomeKit, I don’t know what Android users do with these cameras because the logi app fall 500 miles short in terms of functionality and in cases where one has slow internet can make the cameras unusable even at home in the same network.

I’m very happy with the physical hardware, if you have Apple devices and can use HomeKit I would definitely recommend these cameras, but for right now the Logi app is only good for initial setup of the camera and playing back previously recorded footage, nothing else, all other functionality is found in the Home App on iOS with HomeKit. So if you’re an Android user too I’d wait a little while and see if Logitech gets their act together with this app because it’s nowhere near where it needs to be, I’d go as far as calling it half baked and unfinished.

I’d happily re-review this app and give it a 5-Star rating if you fix these issues, they should be sorted out ASAP, more and more people are going to try your products and the app is going to let them down and you will give yourselves a bad name. You guys still have the opportunity to make a big name for yourselves in this section of the market. Sorting these things out is of utmost importance for keeping this product alive, otherwise someone else will come along and do it better and this product will fade away. It’s been out for over a year, it’s long enough, there’s no time left for any excuses these are major oversights that are frankly embarrassing, you’d expect this from some new startup but not a big company like Logitech.
The Circle 2 has so much potential, please don’t neglect it.

Kind Regards.

title: Great Home Camera
text:
We bought three of these types of cameras for our home, with the assurance from Best Buy we could return any if we did not like.
We are returning the FLIR FX & D-Link HD Pan & Tilt cameras, and exchanging them for Logi Circles. 
Getting started with the FLIR FX & D-Link HD Pan & Tilt cameras were much more difficult and cumbersome than the Logi Circle. 
The FLIR FX & D-Link HD Pan & Tilt also were significantly more complex to view online with our Apple devices (iPhones & iPads). The FLIR FX required us to switch to its' designated Wi-Fi connection in order to view online!
At night, all the cameras reflected their IR lights on our windows' glass, so they did not work so well placed inside the house, looking outside at night. However, we were able to use the Logi Circle camera outside (during both the rain & a rare snow fall in our area, even though it does not say it's rated for outdoor use)! Additionally, the Logi has a magnetic base which I was able to place in more locations securely than any of the other cameras (without having to drill & screw in attachments).
All of the controls were simple to operate & all of its' functions worked exactly as we'd hoped!
Finally, the FLIR FX is $30 more than (and the D-Link HD Pan & Tilt is the same price as) the Logi Circle!
The Logi Circle is what we would buy again & recommend.
